trans-unit.source: HTTP Operations on Blob Service Resources
trans-unit.target: HTTP Operations on Blob Service Resources

trans-unit.source: The Blob service exposes the following resource types via the REST API:
trans-unit.target: The Blob service exposes the following resource types via the REST API:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Account.</embeddedLabel> A storage account is a globally uniquely identified entity within the storage system.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Account.</embeddedLabel> A storage account is a globally uniquely identified entity within the storage system.

trans-unit.source: The account is the parent namespace for the Blob service.
trans-unit.target: The account is the parent namespace for the Blob service.

trans-unit.source: All containers are associated with an account.
trans-unit.target: All containers are associated with an account.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Containers.</embeddedLabel> A container is a user-defined set of blobs within an account.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Containers.</embeddedLabel> A container is a user-defined set of blobs within an account.

trans-unit.source: A container resource has no associated content, only properties and metadata.
trans-unit.target: A container resource has no associated content, only properties and metadata.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Blobs.</embeddedLabel> A blob is an entity representing a set of content.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Blobs.</embeddedLabel> A blob is an entity representing a set of content.

trans-unit.source: A blob resource includes content, properties, and metadata.
trans-unit.target: A blob resource includes content, properties, and metadata.

trans-unit.source: You can address each resource using its resource URI.
trans-unit.target: You can address each resource using its resource URI.

trans-unit.source: For information about URI addresses, see <legacyLink xlink:href="71b719e2-1ade-43fe-adcd-42b7b2ec011f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Referring to Containers and Blobs</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information about URI addresses, see <legacyLink xlink:href="71b719e2-1ade-43fe-adcd-42b7b2ec011f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Referring to Containers and Blobs</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: Each resource supports operations based on the HTTP verbs GET, PUT, HEAD, and DELETE.
trans-unit.target: Each resource supports operations based on the HTTP verbs GET, PUT, HEAD, and DELETE.

trans-unit.source: The verb, syntax, and supported HTTP version(s) for each operation appears on the reference page for each operation.
trans-unit.target: The verb, syntax, and supported HTTP version(s) for each operation appears on the reference page for each operation.

trans-unit.source: For a complete list of operation reference pages, see <link xlink:href="fa36aa0e-256a-488b-bc85-af7c3a230937" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Blob Service REST API</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a complete list of operation reference pages, see <link xlink:href="fa36aa0e-256a-488b-bc85-af7c3a230937" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Blob Service REST API</link>.
